channel.title: Two Questions
channel.description:
Question one :: how do i make my server able to hold more npc dialogs, cuase right now i have almost 50 or more, and when i add anymore then what i got i cant comple it gives me a error saying something about public void being too long.
Question two :: walking has seemed to been disable on my server for some reason....how do i change it back?

item.title: Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @rangergodlv rangergodlv
item.description:
@rangergodlv wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:401301”][quote author=rangergodlv link=topic=498363.msg3651191#msg3651191 date=1309742677]
Ummmm yeah I did reach my 64kb limit…but I don’t know how to make a file to hold more
[/quote]

It’s not the file that reached the limit, it’s the method.[/quote]

well how do i make it so it can handle more? cuase i need alot more npc’s to talk, i only got lumby,varrock,and im currently on the tutorial island.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

rangergodlv:

Ummmm yeah I did reach my 64kb limit…but I don’t know how to make a file to hold more

It’s not the file that reached the limit, it’s the method.

Ummmm yeah I did reach my 64kb limit…but I don’t know how to make a file to hold more

item.title: Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:3, topic:401301”][quote author=X Entinity X link=topic=498363.msg3644487#msg3644487 date=1309279420]
Well if your using Project Insanity you could handle your Npc dialouge like this;

[code] private static void getRandomMessage(Client c) {
int message = Misc.random(22-1);
String[][] messages = {
{“It’s a rather beautiful day isn’t it?”},
{“I’m just your average villager.”},
{“Sorry do I know you?”},
{“You can train throughout the world of RuneScape.”},
{“I’m sorry sir I can’t help you today I’m extremley busy…”},

                    {"Sooo....."},
                    {"Did you know RuneScape is very stable?."},
                    {"Did you know you can do so much!?"},
                    {"I Loved my son.... he was a good fella..."},
                    {"Hi.."},

                    {"It's a rather beautiful day isn't it?"},
                    {"I'm just your average villager."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

                    {"Best be off!"},
                    {"RuneScape, the leading game."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

            };
            sendNpcChat(c, messages[message][0],  c.talkingNpc, ""+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+"");
    }[/code]

And what that is, is every NPC you talk to it will randomise the dialogue, it’s not accurate and needs some work, but it’s still pretty good and simplistic. I’ve made it so all the NPC’S that are ‘talk able’ will that randomised, you can change this by;
c.talkingNpc, “”+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+". It’s also better then making a case for each dialogue you want to make.
[/quote]

He would still have a problem. If he codes all the dialogues into the server, he will still reach the 64KB max length for a method.

What I would suggest is creating a file that holds dialogues, then loading them at startup.[/quote]

True, though I was just telling him how he could make his life easier by making his dialogue like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“X Entinity X, post:2, topic:401301”]Well if your using Project Insanity you could handle your Npc dialouge like this;

[code] private static void getRandomMessage(Client c) {
int message = Misc.random(22-1);
String[][] messages = {
{“It’s a rather beautiful day isn’t it?”},
{“I’m just your average villager.”},
{“Sorry do I know you?”},
{“You can train throughout the world of RuneScape.”},
{“I’m sorry sir I can’t help you today I’m extremley busy…”},

                    {"Sooo....."},
                    {"Did you know RuneScape is very stable?."},
                    {"Did you know you can do so much!?"},
                    {"I Loved my son.... he was a good fella..."},
                    {"Hi.."},

                    {"It's a rather beautiful day isn't it?"},
                    {"I'm just your average villager."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

                    {"Best be off!"},
                    {"RuneScape, the leading game."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

            };
            sendNpcChat(c, messages[message][0],  c.talkingNpc, ""+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+"");
    }[/code]

And what that is, is every NPC you talk to it will randomise the dialogue, it’s not accurate and needs some work, but it’s still pretty good and simplistic. I’ve made it so all the NPC’S that are ‘talk able’ will that randomised, you can change this by;
c.talkingNpc, “”+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+". It’s also better then making a case for each dialogue you want to make.[/quote]

He would still have a problem. If he codes all the dialogues into the server, he will still reach the 64KB max length for a method.

What I would suggest is creating a file that holds dialogues, then loading them at startup.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

Well if your using Project Insanity you could handle your Npc dialouge like this;

[code] private static void getRandomMessage(Client c) {
int message = Misc.random(22-1);
String[][] messages = {
{“It’s a rather beautiful day isn’t it?”},
{“I’m just your average villager.”},
{“Sorry do I know you?”},
{“You can train throughout the world of RuneScape.”},
{“I’m sorry sir I can’t help you today I’m extremley busy…”},

                    {"Sooo....."},
                    {"Did you know RuneScape is very stable?."},
                    {"Did you know you can do so much!?"},
                    {"I Loved my son.... he was a good fella..."},
                    {"Hi.."},

                    {"It's a rather beautiful day isn't it?"},
                    {"I'm just your average villager."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

                    {"Best be off!"},
                    {"RuneScape, the leading game."},
                    {"Sorry do I know you?"},
                    {"You can train throughout the world of RuneScape."},
                    {"I'm sorry sir I can't help you today I'm extremley busy.."},

            };
            sendNpcChat(c, messages[message][0],  c.talkingNpc, ""+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+"");
    }[/code]

And what that is, is every NPC you talk to it will randomise the dialogue, it’s not accurate and needs some work, but it’s still pretty good and simplistic. I’ve made it so all the NPC’S that are ‘talk able’, their dialogue will be randomised, you can change this by;
c.talkingNpc, “”+Server.npcHandler.getNpcListName(c.talkingNpc)+". It’s also better then making a case for each dialogue you want to make.

Read full topic
